summary: Email chain between FBI personnel discussing the placement of a 'silent hit' (travel alert) on Ghislaine Maxwell to notify of any international travel, active from August 27, 2019, to August 27, 2020. The emails indicate coordination to monitor her movements and potentially 'put her in pocket.'

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The target of a 'silent hit' (travel alert) placed by the FBI to monitor her international travel.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: Appears to be coordinating the surveillance operation on Ghislaine Maxwell, requesting travel records and the silent hit.

connections.description: The FBI agent is actively surveilling and coordinating a travel alert on Maxwell.

events.title: Silent Hit Placed on Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A 'silent hit' (travel alert) is completed and activated for Ghislaine Maxwell to notify of any international travel, effective from August 27, 2019, to August 27, 2020.

events.title: Coordination on Maxwell Surveillance
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails confirming the silent hit is active and discussing having Maxwell's travel records from 2000 to present, with the intent to 'put her in pocket.'

keyFacts: The FBI placed a 'silent hit' (a travel alert) on Ghislaine Maxwell on August 27, 2019, active for one year.
The FBI had access to Maxwell's travel records from 2000 to the present (2019).
The communication indicates an active effort to monitor Maxwell's movements with the stated intent to 'put her in pocket,' suggesting an aim to apprehend or control her movements.
The document is an internal FBI email chain dated August 28, 2019, showing coordination on the surveillance operation.
